segment.source: Working with WIM MMOS images
segment.target: Working with WIM MMOS images

segment.source: Working with WIM MMOS images
segment.target: Working with WIM MMOS images

segment.source: Working with WIM MMOS images
segment.target: Working with WIM MMOS images

segment.source: You can temporarily copy a WIM (Windows Imaging) image over to a device and then boot to that image running in volatile RAM memory.
segment.target: You can temporarily copy a WIM (Windows Imaging) image over to a device and then boot to that image running in volatile RAM memory.

segment.source: This capability can be used to service the device using MMOS.
segment.target: This capability can be used to service the device using MMOS.

segment.source: For more info about MMOS, see Microsoft Manufacturing OS.
segment.target: For more info about MMOS, see Microsoft Manufacturing OS.

segment.source: The advantage of using this approach for servicing is that you will not need to reserve space on the retail OS for code that is only used in servicing.
segment.target: The advantage of using this approach for servicing is that you will not need to reserve space on the retail OS for code that is only used in servicing.

segment.source: Minimizing the space that is consumed by the OS is an important consideration in low cost devices.
segment.target: Minimizing the space that is consumed by the OS is an important consideration in low cost devices.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Only MMOS test images are currently supported.
segment.target: Only MMOS test images are currently supported.

segment.source: Retail signing is not currently supported.
segment.target: Retail signing is not currently supported.

segment.source: Creating a WIM Image
segment.target: Creating a WIM Image

segment.source: Before you create a WIM image, you must complete the steps described in the following topics:
segment.target: Before you create a WIM image, you must complete the steps described in the following topics:

segment.source: MMOS image definition
segment.target: MMOS image definition

segment.source: In addition, follow these guidelines to prepare an image so that it will operate properly when converted to a WIM image.
segment.target: In addition, follow these guidelines to prepare an image so that it will operate properly when converted to a WIM image.

segment.source: The following XML shows an example of the Microsoft features that can be used in a test WIM Image.
segment.target: The following XML shows an example of the Microsoft features that can be used in a test WIM Image.

segment.source: You may want to add additional features such as battery charging (ENABLEMMOSCHARGING) depending on your needs.
segment.target: You may want to add additional features such as battery charging (ENABLEMMOSCHARGING) depending on your needs.

segment.source: For additional info about the MMOS features, see MMOS image definition.
segment.target: For additional info about the MMOS features, see MMOS image definition.

segment.source: Do not include packages that access other partitions on the device.
segment.target: Do not include packages that access other partitions on the device.

segment.source: Because the WIM is loaded and running in RAM, it is not able to access other partitions and the OS cannot contain packages that reference other partitions.
segment.target: Because the WIM is loaded and running in RAM, it is not able to access other partitions and the OS cannot contain packages that reference other partitions.

segment.source: After you complete the steps in the preceding topics, use the ImgToWIM command to convert the signed FFU image to a WIM image.
segment.target: After you complete the steps in the preceding topics, use the ImgToWIM command to convert the signed FFU image to a WIM image.

segment.source: The ImgToWim executable is located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.
segment.target: The ImgToWim executable is located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.

segment.source: The usage is summarized here.
segment.target: The usage is summarized here.

segment.source: When you enter the ImgToWim command, you should see output that is similar to the following.
segment.target: When you enter the ImgToWim command, you should see output that is similar to the following.

segment.source: Booting from a WIM Image
segment.target: Booting from a WIM Image

segment.source: Use the FFUTool WIM option to boot from a WIM image.
segment.target: Use the FFUTool WIM option to boot from a WIM image.

segment.source: The usage is summarized here.
segment.target: The usage is summarized here.

segment.source: To boot the device from a WIM image, complete the following steps.
segment.target: To boot the device from a WIM image, complete the following steps.

segment.source: Set up the PC side flashing tools.
segment.target: Set up the PC side flashing tools.

segment.source: Put the device in flashing mode by holding the volume up button while powering up the device.
segment.target: Put the device in flashing mode by holding the volume up button while powering up the device.

segment.source: After the device is in flashing mode, connect the USB cable to your computer.
segment.target: After the device is in flashing mode, connect the USB cable to your computer.

segment.source: Use the FFUTool command with the -WIM option to boot a device from a WIM image.
segment.target: Use the FFUTool command with the -WIM option to boot a device from a WIM image.

segment.source: It is located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.
segment.target: It is located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.

segment.source: When you enter the FFUTool -WIM command, you should see output that is similar to the following.
segment.target: When you enter the FFUTool -WIM command, you should see output that is similar to the following.

segment.source: The ffutool sends a WIM opcode to the device, along with information about the size of the image.
segment.target: The ffutool sends a WIM opcode to the device, along with information about the size of the image.

segment.source: Next a RAM buffer is allocated that will hold image.
segment.target: Next a RAM buffer is allocated that will hold image.

segment.source: The ffutool then transfers the WIM image to the device.
segment.target: The ffutool then transfers the WIM image to the device.

segment.source: Once it’s fully transferred, the device boots into the WIM image in memory.
segment.target: Once it’s fully transferred, the device boots into the WIM image in memory.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The current MMOS WIM images may not display the rotating disc graphic but MMOS is still functional.
segment.target: The current MMOS WIM images may not display the rotating disc graphic but MMOS is still functional.
